Name: DiskOthersFreeSpaceMegabytes
Title: Disk (others): Free space megabytes
Notes: Scores the free disk space across non-system disk(s). A lower score indicates that these disks are running low on space and space may need to be released.

Name: DiskOthersUsageTimePercent
Title: Disk (others): Usage time percent
Notes: Scores the percentage of time that non-system disk(s) were servicing requests. A lower score indicates these disk(s) may be excessively busy.

Name: DiskSystemFreeSpaceMegabytes
Title: Disk (system): Free space megabytes
Notes: Scores the free disk space on the system disk. A lower score indicates that this disk is running low on space and space may need to be released.

Name: DiskSystemUsageTimePercent
Title: Disk (system): Usage time percent
Notes: Scores the percentage of time that the system disk was servicing requests. A lower score indicates this disk may be excessively busy.

Name: MemoryUsageMegabytes
Title: Memory: Used megabytes
Notes: The amount of physical memory in use.

Name: NetworkActiveTcpConnections
Title: Network: Active TCP connections
Notes: The average number of active (inbound and output) TCP connections.

Name: NetworkBytesReceivedPerSecond
Title: Network: Bytes received per second
Notes: The average number of bytes received per second across all network adapters.

Name: NetworkBytesSentPerSecond
Title: Network: Bytes sent per second
Notes: The average number of bytes sent per second across all network adapters.

Name: ProcessorTimeSeconds
Title: Processor: Processor seconds
Notes: The average number of CPU seconds (amount of processor work) per second. A value of 1 indicates that a single CPU core was entirely busy for a second.

Name: PerformanceAnomalies
Title: Device Performance Anomalies
Notes: Scores the frequency of general performance anomalies reported for the device. A lower score indicates that this device may need to be investigated.

Name: OsPerformanceAnomalies
Title: Operating System: Performance Anomalies
Notes: Scores the frequency of operating system performance anomalies. A lower score indicates that the operating system on this device may need to be investigated, upgraded or reinstalled.

Name: SoftwarePerformanceAnomalies
Title: Software: Performance Anomalies
Notes: Scores the frequency of software performance anomalies. A lower score indicates that software on the device may be misconfigured or underperforming.

Name: OtherDisks
Title: Non-System disk performance
Notes: An indicator of non-system disk load and throughput.

Metadata.Name: DiskOthersSplitIoPerSecond
Metadata.Title: Disk (others): Split I/O per second
Metadata.Notes: Scores the I/O operations that were broken into multiple requests across non-system disk(s). A lower score may indicate excessive disk fragmentation.

Metadata.Name: DiskOthersAverageQueueLength
Metadata.Title: Disk (others): Average queue length
Metadata.Notes: Scores the average queue length for non-system disk(s). A lower score indicates that these disk(s) are not keeping up with the I/O backlog.

Metadata.Name: DiskOthersAverageSecondsPerWrite
Metadata.Title: Disk (others): Average seconds per write
Metadata.Notes: Scores the average time taken for non-system disk(s) to perform a write. A lower score indicates that these disk(s) are taking too long to service write requests.

Name: Experience
Title: Experience
Notes: A score that provides a weighted indicator of device performance, stability, responsiveness and user sentiment.

Metadata.Name: Performance
Metadata.Title: Performance
Metadata.Notes: A score that provides a weighted indicator of the load and throughput of processor, memory and disk resources.

Metadata.Name: SystemDisks
Metadata.Title: System disk performance
Metadata.Notes: An indicator of system disk load and throughput.

Metadata.Name: DiskSystemSplitIoPerSecond
Metadata.Title: Disk (system): Split I/O per second
Metadata.Notes: Scores the I/O operations that were broken into multiple requests on the system disk. A lower score may indicate excessive disk fragmentation.

Metadata.Name: DiskSystemAverageQueueLength
Metadata.Title: Disk (system): Average queue length
Metadata.Notes: Scores the average queue length for the system disk. A lower score indicates that this disk is not keeping up with the I/O backlog.

Metadata.Name: DiskSystemAverageSecondsPerWrite
Metadata.Title: Disk (system): Average seconds per write
Metadata.Notes: Scores the average time taken for the system disk to perform a write. A lower score indicates that this disk is taking too long to service write requests.

Metadata.Name: CPU
Metadata.Title: CPU performance
Metadata.Notes: An indication of processor load and throughput.

Metadata.Name: ProcessorQueueLength
Metadata.Title: Processor: Queue length
Metadata.Notes: Scores the CPU queue length (backlog of processing work). A lower score means that the CPU is not keeping up with the workload.

Metadata.Name: ProcessorInterruptTimePercent
Metadata.Title: Processor: Percent interrupt time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the amount of time the CPU spent servicing interrupts. A lower score may indicate faulty or misconfigured hardware/drivers.

Metadata.Name: ProcessorTimePercent
Metadata.Title: Processor: Processor time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the CPU load. A lower score indicates that the CPU is fully loaded and additional processing power may be required.

Metadata.Name: Memory
Metadata.Title: Memory performance
Metadata.Notes: A score that indicates memory load and system paging activity.

Metadata.Name: MemoryHardPageFaultsPerSecond
Metadata.Title: Memory: Hard page faults
Metadata.Notes: Scores the amount of memory pages that had to be read from disk-based storage. A lower score indicates this device is low on available physical memory.

Metadata.Name: MemoryPageFileUsagePercent
Metadata.Title: Memory: Page file usage
Metadata.Notes: Scores the percentage of the page file that is in use. A lower score indicates more high page file use, which may mean the device is low on available physical memory.

Metadata.Name: MemoryUsagePercent
Metadata.Title: Memory: Physical memory usage
Metadata.Notes: Scores the percentage of physical memory in use. A lower score indicates higher memory consumption, and therefore less available physical memory.

Metadata.Name: OsMemory
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Memory access time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to allocate, zero and free a block of memory. A lower score indicates that the operating system is slow to serve memory requests, which may affect application performance.

Metadata.Name: Network
Metadata.Title: Network
Metadata.Notes: The Network performance score indicates a measurement of local network stack performance, it doesnâ€™t include external network consideration like latency. If this value is low you may wish to consider improving Network performance.

Metadata.Name: OsUDPSend
Metadata.Title: Operating System: UDP send time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to perform a basic loopback UDP send. A lower score may indicate problems with the operating system network stack.

Metadata.Name: NetworkOutputQueueLength
Metadata.Title: Network: Output queue length
Metadata.Notes: Length of the output packet queue.

Metadata.Name: WirelessSignalQuality
Metadata.Title: Network: Wireless signal quality
Metadata.Notes: Wireless signal quality is a percentage value that represents the signal quality of the wireless network capability on the endpoint. A value of 100% is optimal, as the figure degrades it will proportionally reduce the network bandwidth of wireless networking.

Metadata.Name: Stability
Metadata.Title: Stability
Metadata.Notes: An indication of the frequency of operating system and software crashes and hangs and service failures.

Metadata.Name: OsCrashes
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Crashes
Metadata.Notes: Scores the frequency of operating system crashes (Blue Screens, or unexpected shutdowns). A lower score indicates crash activity, which is likely to be caused by a faulty or misconfigured device drive.

Metadata.Name: OsServiceFailures
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Service Failures
Metadata.Notes: Scores the frequency of service failures (where a service fails to start or shutdown correctly). A lower score indicates problematic services which may need to be investigated.

Metadata.Name: SoftwareCrashes
Metadata.Title: Software: Crashes
Metadata.Notes: Scores the frequency of software crashes. A lower score indicates a high rate of crashes. The Devices screen Logs tab can assist with investigation of software crashes.

Metadata.Name: SoftwareHangs
Metadata.Title: Software: Hangs
Metadata.Notes: Scores the frequency of software hangs (where an application becomes unresponsive). A lower score indicates a high rate of hangs.

Metadata.Name: Responsiveness
Metadata.Title: Responsiveness
Metadata.Notes: An indication of the timeliness of operating system startup and system resource creation and availability.

Metadata.Name: WindowsInternals
Metadata.Title: Windows internals
Metadata.Notes: An indication of the timeliness of Windows system resource creation and availability.

Metadata.Name: WindowsFilesystem
Metadata.Title: Windows filesystem
Metadata.Notes: A score that indicates file system and disk access speed.

Metadata.Name: OsCreateFile
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Create file time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to create an empty, temporary file. A lower score indicates that the operating system may be underperforming in terms of basic file operations.

Metadata.Name: OsDiskRand
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Disk random access time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to perform a random access disk operation on the system drive. A lower score indicates poor random disk access performance.

Metadata.Name: OsDiskSeq
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Disk sequential access time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to perform a sequential access disk operation on the system drive. A lower score indicates poor sequential disk access performance.

Metadata.Name: WindowsRegistry
Metadata.Title: Windows registry
Metadata.Notes: An indication of Windows registry access speed.

Metadata.Name: OsRegReadHKLM
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Registry read HKLM time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to read from the HKLM Windows Registry hive. A lower score indicates poor registry read performance, which in turn may affect application performance.

Metadata.Name: OsRegWriteHKCU
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Registry write HKCU time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to write to the HKCU Windows Registry hive. A lower score indicates poor registry write performance, which in turn may affect application performance.

Metadata.Name: OsRegWriteHKLM
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Registry write HKLM time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to write to the HKLM Windows Registry hive. A lower score indicates poor registry write performance, which in turn may affect application performance.

Metadata.Name: Processes
Metadata.Title: Processes and threads
Metadata.Notes: A score that indicates Windows process and thread creation and startup speed.

Metadata.Name: OsCreateProcess
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Create process time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to create a new process. A lower score indicates that the operating system is taking a long time to create new processes.

Metadata.Name: OsCreateThread
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Create thread time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to create a new thread within a process. A lower score indicates that the operating system is taking a long time to create new threads.

Metadata.Name: OsOpenHandle
Metadata.Title: Operating System: OpenHandle time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to acquire a basic operating system resource. A lower score indicates that applications may underperform because the operating system is slow to service resource requests.

Metadata.Name: OsLoadDLL
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Load DLL time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to load and unload a DLL in a process. A lower score indicates library loading is slow, which may affect the startup time of applications.

Metadata.Name: Startup
Metadata.Title: System startup
Metadata.Notes: An indication of the timeliness of operating system startup.

Metadata.Name: OsBootTimeSeconds
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Boot time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken for the device to boot to the logon prompt. A lower score indicates a long boot up duration, which may affect user satisfaction.

Metadata.Name: Desktop
Metadata.Title: Windows UI
Metadata.Notes: An indication of graphical window creation and operation speed.

Metadata.Name: OsCreateWindow
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Create window time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to generate an empty window. A lower score indicates poor Windows desktop performance, which may cause applications to appear unresponsive.

Metadata.Name: OsMessageDispatch
Metadata.Title: Operating System: Message dispatch time
Metadata.Notes: Scores the time taken to dispatch and confirm processing of a windows message. A lower score indicates poor message processing throughput, which may affect application responsiveness.

Metadata.Name: Sentiment
Metadata.Title: User sentiment
Metadata.Notes: Users feeling or opinion of device performance, stability and responsiveness.

Metadata.Title: asdfasdf
Metadata.Notes: asdfasdf

Metadata.Title: dgfgdf

Metadata.Name: NewName
Metadata.Title: New Name
Metadata.Notes: Question Test

Name: UserSessionReactiveness
Title: User: Session Reactiveness
Notes: A score that indicates the reactiveness of the user session on a device by considering user wait time and responsiveness of foreground windows

Metadata.Name: UserWaitTime
Metadata.Title: User: User Wait Time
Metadata.Notes: A score that indicates the ratio between the user had to wait due to a busy system and their total interaction time.

Metadata.Name: ForegroundMessageProcessingTime
Metadata.Title: User: Foreground Message Processing Time
Metadata.Notes: A score that indicates the responsiveness of the user foreground windows

Name: NetworkBroadcastRate
Title: Network: Broadcast rate
Notes: Network broadcast rate is defined as the sum of multicast packets that have been sent and received per second. It represents the total for all physical network interfaces on the endpoint.

Name: NetworkPacketRate
Title: Network: Packet rate
Notes: Network packet rate is defined as the sum of all TCP packets that have been sent and received per second. It represents a measure of network resource utilization on the endpoint.

Name: WirelessReceiveRate
Title: Network: Wireless receive rate
Notes: Wireless receive rate is the maximum possible link layer receive transfer speed that can be expected from the Wireless networking on the endpoint.

Name: WirelessTransmitRate
Title: Network: Wireless transmit rate
Notes: Wireless transmit rate is the maximum possible link layer send transfer speed that can be expected from the Wireless networking on the endpoint.

Name: NetworkNetRetransmitRate
Title: Network: Net retransmit rate
Notes: The TCP/IP stack retransmits a TCP segment in case an acknowledge from the recipient of the segment is not seen. This normally happens when the TCP segment is dropped in transit. This counters measures the rate of TCP segment (both IPv4 and IPv6) retransmissions done per second. A higher retransmission rate is indicative of a problem in the network causing network packet loss.

Name: NetworkUsageAverageUserLoggedIn
Title: Network: Usage average user logged in
Notes: This counter defines the average network bandwidth used on a device when a user is active on the device. If the user is not logged in or machine is idle (locked), then this value is sent empty.

Name: NetworkPacketsOutboundDiscarded
Title: Network: Packets outbound discarded
Notes: This counter defines the number of outgoing packets dropped by the network adapter. This can happen if there is no outbound transmit buffers available. This situation can occur if the data to transmit is high as compared to available transmit bandwidth.

Name: NetworkPacketsOutboundErrors
Title: Network: Packets outbound errors
Notes: This indicates the number of outgoing packets dropped by the network adapter due to errors at physical layer, like loss of carrier during transmission.

Name: NetworkPacketsReceivedDiscarded
Title: Network: Packets received discarded
Notes: This counter gives the number of incoming packets dropped due to non availability of receive buffers to store the incoming frames. This indicates that the rate of incoming packets is higher than the rate of packets being consumed by the system from the receive buffers.

Name: NetworkPacketsReceivedErrors
Title: Network: Packets received errors
Notes: This counter indicates the number of packets dropped by the network adapter due to various errors at physical layer, like CRC errors, MTU error, frame too long, invalid frame length etc.

Name: NetworkUtilizationPercent
Title: Network: Bandwidth utilization
Notes: Bandwidth saturationÂ occurs when all a circuits available bandwidth in a given direction is being utilized by a large upload or download; this results high latency and performance issues as subsequent packets start to buffer, eventually timing out and displaying symptoms such as slow speeds and packet loss.

Name: BootMachineGroupPolicyProcessingTimeSeconds
Title: Boot Performance: Machine Group Policy Processing Time Seconds
Notes: Time taken at boot time to apply Machine Group Policy settings. In the unlikely case when the Boot Group Policy event is not logged by Windows, we pick the closest periodic or manual Machine Group Policy Processing event to the Boot time.

Name: BootUserGroupPolicyProcessingTimeSeconds
Title: Boot Performance: User Group Policy Processing Time Seconds
Notes: Time taken at boot time to apply User Group Policy settings. In the unlikely case when the Boot Group Policy event is not logged by Windows, we pick the closest periodic or manual User Group Policy Processing event to the Boot time.

Name: BootMainPathBootTimeSeconds
Title: Boot Performance: Main Path Boot Time Seconds
Notes: Main path boot time starts when you see the Start Windows splash screen and ends when the desktop appears.

Name: BootPostBootTimeSeconds
Title: Boot Performance: Post Boot Time Seconds
Notes: Post boot time starts when the desktop appears. During this time, services and application may be starting but it is not considered complete until the system has reached a certain idle state.

Name: BootStartupAppsTimeSeconds
Title: Boot Performance: Startup Apps Time Seconds
Notes: Shows the combined "CPU at start-up" time for all application under the 'Startup' tab in Windows Task Manager.

Name: CrashesSum
Title: Software: Total crashes
Notes: The total number of software crashes for the application.

Name: HandleCount
Title: Software: Handles
Notes: The average number of handles in use by the application.

Name: HangsSum
Title: Software: Total hangs
Notes: The total number of software hangs for the application.

Name: InstanceCount
Title: Software: Instances
Notes: The average number of application instances.

Name: PerformanceAnomaliesSum
Title: Software: Total performance anomalies
Notes: The total number of performance anomalies detected for the application.

Name: SensitivityImpactPercent
Title: Software: Sensitivity impact
Notes: How sensitive this application appears to be in relation to operating system activity. A higher value means that this application has been seen to be consuming more CPU resources when the operating system itself is working harder, which may adversely affect the performance of the device overall (the software is â€œgetting in the wayâ€ of the operating system). This behavior is typically seen in agent-based software which hooks in to the operating system, such as anti-virus and anti-malware products, or other similar security/monitoring software.

Name: SoftwareDeviceCount
Title: Software: Total devices
Notes: The total number of devices reporting performance data for the application.

Name: IoReadKilobytesPerSecond
Title: Disk: Kilobytes read per second
Notes: The average number of kilobytes read per second for the application.

Name: IoWriteKilobytesPerSecond
Title: Disk: Kilobytes written per second
Notes: The average number of kilobytes written per second for the application.

Name: MemoryUsagePhysicalKilobytes
Title: Memory: Physical memory usage
Notes: The amount of physical memory in use by the application.

Name: MemoryUsageVirtualKilobytes
Title: Memory: Virtual memory usage
Notes: The amount of virtual memory in use by the application.

Name: ProcessorTimeSecondsPerSecond
Title: Processor: Processor time seconds
Notes: The average number of CPU seconds (amount of processor work) per second for the application. A value of 1 indicates that a single CPU core was entirely busy for a second.

Name: SoftwareProcessorTimePercent
Title: Processor: Process time
Notes: The average CPU load generated by the application.

Name: Software_DiskReadIops
Title: Disk: Disk read Iops
Notes: Average number of IO read operations per second for the application.

Name: Software_DiskWriteIops
Title: Disk: Disk write Iops
Notes: Average number of IO write operations per second the application.

Name: Software_NetworkBytesReceivedPerSecond
Title: Network: Bytes received per second
Notes: The average number of bytes received per second across all network adapters for the application.

Name: Software_NetworkBytesSentPerSecond
Title: Network: Bytes sent per second
Notes: The average number of bytes sent per second across all network adapters for the application.

Name: Software_NetworkBytesExchangedPerSecond
Title: Network: Bytes exchange per second
Notes: The average number of bytes exchanged per second across all network adapters for the application.

Name: Software_NetworkTotalDataReceivedMegabytes
Title: Network: Total megabytes received
Notes: The total megabytes received across all network adapters for the application.

Name: Software_NetworkTotalDataSentMegabytes
Title: Network: Total megabytes sent
Notes: The total megabytes sent across all network adapters for the application.
